parameters.name: ReverseDir
parameters.description: True reverses the angle direction, false does not

parameters.name: RevType
parameters.description: Type of revolution as defined in swRevolveType_e

parameters.name: Options
parameters.description: Additional control as defined in swRevolveOptions_e

parameters.name: Merge
parameters.description: True to merge the results in a multibody part, false to not

parameters.name: UseFeatScope
parameters.description: True if the feature only affects selected bodies, false if the feature affects all bodies

parameters.name: UseAutoSel
parameters.description: True to automatically select all bodies and have the feature affect those bodies, false to select the bodies or components the feature affects (see Remarks )

title: IFeatureManager.FeatureRevolve
signature:
Feature FeatureRevolve( 
   System.Double
Angle
,
   System.Boolean
ReverseDir
,
   System.Double
Angle2
,
   System.Int32
RevType
,
   System.Int32
Options
,
   System.Boolean
Merge
,
   System.Boolean
UseFeatScope
,
   System.Boolean
UseAutoSel
)

parameters.name: ReverseDir
parameters.description: True reverses the angle direction, false does not

parameters.name: RevType
parameters.description: Type of revolution as defined in swRevolveType_e

parameters.name: Options
parameters.description: Additional control as defined in swRevolveOptions_e

parameters.name: Merge
parameters.description: True to merge the results in a multibody part, false to not

parameters.name: UseFeatScope
parameters.description: True if the feature only affects selected bodies, false if the feature affects all bodies

parameters.name: UseAutoSel
parameters.description: True to automatically select all bodies and have the feature affect those bodies, false to select the bodies or components the feature affects (see Remarks )

remarks:
To select an axis for a revolve feature, first call
IModelDocExtension::SelectByID2
with Mark set to 4. When UseAutoSel is false, the user must select the bodies  or components that the feature will affect.
